newsitem.title: FRANCE: Socgen official to head Credit du Nord.
newsitem.headline: Socgen official to head Credit du Nord.

text.p: Bruno Flichy, deputy director general of Societe Generale, will soon become president of Credit du Nord, Societe Generale said in a statement.
On March 10 Flichy became a member and the vice-president of the supervisory board of Credit du Nord, it said.
He will become president of the bank's supervisory board, following a shareholders meeting on April 15.
Flichy will also act as an adviser to Societe Generale's president and remain a member of the bank's management committee.
Flichy, who headed the individuals and corporate branch at Societe Generale, will be replaced by Philippe Citerne, deputy director general in charge of resources and services.
Groupe Paribas has agreed to sell its Credit du Nord banking unit to Societe Generale. The acquisition will be effective on April 15.
